medical_history.chief_complaint: Aortic root dilation and moderate aortic valve incompetence due to Arterial tortuosity syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At birth, the patient experienced a cardiac arrest. Dilation and elongation of the ascending aorta and arch was observed, followed by narrowing of the descending thoracic aorta. A progressive dilation of the sinus portion and sinotubular junction was noted from February 2004 to January 2005. The patient had recurrent episodes of thoracic pain in March 2005, with further echocardiographic findings showing increased aortic sinus dilation and moderate aortic valve incompetence.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Arterial tortuosity syndrome (ATS); cardiac arrest at birth.
medical_history.family_history: One older sibling with ATS; two out of three cousins also affected.
